title: `unused_doc_comments` warning reported for each doc comment line on macro invocation, unlike on other expressions

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
Other expressions work as expected: it reports just one error, for the whole sequence of doc comment lines.

```rust
macro_rules! foo { () => {}; }

fn main() {
    /// line1
    /// line2
    /// line3
    foo!();
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c41b81351bf2c3092b1fe60635965068))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: unused doc comment
 --> src/main.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     /// line1
  |     ^^^^^^^^^ rustdoc does not generate documentation for macro invocations
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_doc_comments)]` on by default
  = help: to document an item produced by a macro, the macro must produce the documentation as part of its expansion

warning: unused doc comment
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 |     /// line2
  |     ^^^^^^^^^ rustdoc does not generate documentation for macro invocations
  |
  = help: to document an item produced by a macro, the macro must produce the documentation as part of its expansion

warning: unused doc comment
 --> src/main.rs:6:5
  |
6 |     /// line3
  |     ^^^^^^^^^ rustdoc does not generate documentation for macro invocations
  |
  = help: to document an item produced by a macro, the macro must produce the documentation as part of its expansion

warning: 3 warnings emitted

    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.65s
     Running `target/debug/playground`

```
